On Thu, 19 May 2005 11:32:52 -0400, Elliotte Harold  
<elharo@...> wrote:

> I'm wondering if anyone has any good ideas for examples to use in this
> course?Any ideas?

How about XWiki [www.xwiki.org]? This provides a modern paradigm  
(Webservice, portlet, OR mapping), a real complex bundle of near-enough  
standard OSS solutions (Hibernate, Radeox, MySQL etc). It is now  
Subversion, Cruise Controlled and JUnited on ObjectWeb.

A possibly interesting problem and therefore task is to design a test  
suite which can cater for continuous technology substitution. In this case  
it appears that XWiki has html, css, xml, vm, groovy, javascript etc  
simultaneously in production code? How to design testing solutions for a  
real-world business case might be a useful learning exercise?

Best Wishes

Jim
